commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I looked at the table of language percentages and identified the percentages for Italian language and Indo-European languages. I then subtracted the percentage of people who spoke Indo-European languages at home from the percentage of people who spoke Italian language at home to get the answer of 0.20 or 0.2. 

To solve the problem better, I could have used a calculator to ensure accuracy in the subtraction. Additionally, I could have double-checked my calculations to make sure I did not make any errors.
final_answer: The answer to the problem is 0.20.
problem_text:
Context:
As of 2010, 46.29% (584,463) of Bronx residents aged five and older spoke Spanish language at home, while 44.02% (555,767) spoke English language, 2.48% (31,361) Languages of Africa, 0.91% (11,455) French language, 0.90% (11,355) Italian language, 0.87% (10,946) Indo-Aryan languages, 0.70% (8,836) Indo-European languages, and Chinese language was spoken at home by 0.50% (6,610) of the population over the age of five. In total, 55.98% (706,783) of the Bronxs population age five and older spoke a language at home other than English. A Garifuna language-speaking community from Honduras and Guatemala also makes the Bronx its home.

Question:
How many more percentage spoke Italian language at home then Indo-European?

steps.step_response:
Yes, creating a table or list to organize the given information would be helpful. Here is a possible table:

| Language             | Percentage |
|----------------------|------------|
| Spanish              | 46.29%     |
| English              | 44.02%     |
| Languages of Africa  | 2.48%      |
| French               | 0.91%      |
| Italian              | 0.90%      |
| Indo-Aryan           | 0.87%      |
| Indo-European        | 0.70%      |
| Chinese              | 0.50%      |

Note: The percentages are rounded to two decimal places.
